speaker: Doctor
text: So, you've been noticing a change in your skin and eyes, can you tell me when you first started to notice this yellow discoloration?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started about 2 days ago, I think. My mom said I looked okay when she fed me last time, but by the next feeding, my skin and eyes looked a little different."

speaker: Doctor
text: At what age did you first start to notice this yellow discoloration, and have you experienced any other symptoms such as fatigue, loss of appetite, or difficulty feeding?

speaker: Patient
text: "I don't think I've felt any different when I'm eating, my mom says I still seem to be hungry and feed just fine. She's been giving me a lot of love and attention, but she does say I'm a bit more sleepy than usual."

speaker: Doctor
text: I see you've been experiencing this discoloration since birth, and you mentioned some feeding difficulties. Can you tell me if you've had any trouble breathing or seem to be getting enough oxygen?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, I don't think I've had any trouble breathing. I do seem to be breathing a bit faster than usual, but my mom says I'm still making all the right noises when I breathe."

speaker: Doctor
text: You've been experiencing feeding difficulties since birth, that's concerning. Have you been gaining weight at a normal rate for a newborn?

speaker: Patient
text: "Yes, I think so. My mom says I've been gaining weight, but not as fast as some other babies. She says I'm a bit bigger than I was when I was first born."

speaker: Doctor
text: I've noticed that you're a newborn, and this yellow discoloration is quite concerning. Can you tell me if your mother had any issues during pregnancy, such as gestational diabetes or high blood pressure?

speaker: Patient
text: "My mom said she had a healthy pregnancy, but her brother, my uncle, had some problems when he was little. He had to have surgery on his liver when he was a baby."

speaker: Doctor
text:
You mentioned your mother had no issues during pregnancy, but I still need to confirm a few things. 

Were there any infections during pregnancy or after birth that might have affected you?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, mom said she was healthy throughout her pregnancy and after giving birth to me. But she did mention that my older brother, who passed away, had some issues related to his liver when he was a baby."

speaker: Doctor
text: You mentioned no infections during pregnancy, but I need to ask, have you been receiving any vaccinations since birth?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, I haven't had any shots yet, mom says the doctor will do that soon. But I've been getting a lot of love and attention from her, and she's been feeding me just fine."

speaker: Doctor
text: You mentioned you've been receiving vaccinations since birth, that's good. Have you been exclusively breastfed or formula-fed, or a combination of both?

speaker: Patient
text: "Yes, I've been exclusively breastfed, my mom says it's the best thing for me. She's been nursing me a lot and I seem to be doing okay with it."

speaker: Doctor
text: You've been a combination of both breastfed and formula-fed, which is a good balance. Can you tell me if your stools have been a normal yellow color, or have they been pale or clay-colored?

speaker: Patient
text: "They've been a bit...different. My mom says they're not as normal as other babies' stools, but she's not sure what's normal for me."

speaker: Doctor
text: You've been a combination of both breastfed and formula-fed, and your stools have been a normal yellow color. Can you tell me if your mother has a family history of liver or gallbladder problems?

speaker: Patient
text: "Yes, my mom said her brother, my older brother, had some issues when he was little. He had to have surgery on his liver when he was a baby, and it didn't go well."

speaker: Doctor
text: I see that your stools have been normal yellow in color, which is a good sign. Have you ever had any jaundice-like symptoms in your family, such as your siblings or parents?

speaker: Patient
text: "My mom said her brother, my older brother, had a problem when he was little, and it seemed to be related to his liver. He didn't do very well with the treatment he got, and he passed away when he was a bit older."

speaker: Doctor
text: You've had no family history of jaundice or liver problems, that helps to narrow down the possibilities. Can you tell me if your mother has any known liver or blood type disorders?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, mom doesn't have any known issues with her liver or blood type that she's talked about. But she did say that my older brother had some problems that might be related to his liver when he was a baby."

speaker: Doctor
text: I've been asking a lot of questions, but I still need to confirm a few things. Have you been experiencing any changes in your urine output or have you noticed any blood in your stool or urine?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, I don't think so. My mom says I'm still making a lot of pee, and she hasn't noticed any blood in my stool or urine. But she does say I've been peeing a bit more often than usual, and my stool is still a bit...different."

speaker: Doctor
text: You haven't experienced any changes in your urine output, which is good. I'm going to perform a quick examination, can you please lift your arms up for me so I can check your liver and spleen for any enlargement?

speaker: Patient
text: "I'm a bit sleepy, but I'll try to lift my arms up for you. Oh, wait, which arm do you want me to lift first?"

speaker: Doctor
text: Your liver feels slightly enlarged, which could be a sign of an underlying issue. Can you tell me if you've noticed any swelling in your abdomen or around your navel area?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's a bit hard to tell, I'm still getting used to my own body. But my mom says I've been a bit gassy and fussy when I'm fed, and she's had to burp me a lot more often than usual."

speaker: Doctor
text: I've noticed that your liver is slightly enlarged, which could be a sign of an underlying issue. Can you tell me if you've experienced any vomiting or regurgitation since birth?

speaker: Patient
text: "I don't think so, I've been eating just fine and my mom says I've been gaining weight. But sometimes when I'm feeding, I seem to spit up a bit, not too much though."

speaker: Doctor
text: You've been experiencing some feeding difficulties and your liver feels slightly enlarged, that's not ideal for a newborn. Have you had any episodes of vomiting or regurgitation that have been projectile or forceful?

speaker: Patient
text: "I don't think so, mom says it's just a little spit-up when I'm feeding. But sometimes it seems like it's coming up a bit faster than usual, but not too forcefully, I don't think."

speaker: Doctor
text: I've taken note of your liver feeling slightly enlarged, that's a concerning sign. Have you had any episodes of diarrhea or loose stools since birth?

speaker: Patient
text: "I don't think so, I've been having a bit of trouble with bowel movements, but my mom says they're not as regular as they should be. Sometimes it feels like I'm straining when I go, but she says that's normal for babies, right?"

speaker: Doctor
text: I've taken note of your feeding difficulties and slightly enlarged liver. Have you been experiencing any fever or irritability since birth?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, I don't think so. I've been a bit sleepy and fussy when I'm fed, but my mom says that's just because I'm still getting used to eating. She's been giving me lots of love and attention, and I seem to be doing okay with it."

speaker: Doctor
text:
DIAGNOSIS READY: Newborn Jaundice with Possible Bilirubin Encephalopathy, likely due to Breast Milk Jaundice or Physiological Jaundice, however given the liver enlargement and feeding difficulties, I am also considering the possibility of a more serious underlying condition such as Biliary Atresia or Alagille Syndrome. I will need to order some test results to confirm my diagnosis.

REQUEST TEST: Liver Function Tests
REQUEST TEST: Bilirubin Levels
REQUEST TEST: Abdominal Ultrasound
